headline: Homemade Ranch Dressing
description: This homemade ranch dressing recipe is quick to make with flavorful dried herbs. It's delicious drizzled on salads or used as a dip for pizza and wings.

video.description: This dressing is tangy with flavors of herbs. Mmm!
video.name: Ranch Dressing II

name: Homemade Ranch Dressing

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk together mayonnaise, sour cream, chives, parsley, dill, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper in a large bowl until well-combined.
Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: I made this as written with the addition of buttermilk. The flavor is much better than bottled, but the mayo seems to overpower everything else, so the next time I make this, I will scale back on the mayo. It didn't have that "tang" like restaurant ranch, although it was very good.

This tasty dressing is mild but herb forward. I wanted this to be a thinner dip so I used 1/2 cup mayo, 1/2 cup buttermilk and 1/2 cup sour cream. I substituted 1 teaspoon of minced fresh chives for the dried because I had them growing outdoors and it gave it a very fresh taste.
Do easy and very tasty, i used a lil extra garlic, onion powder and chives. Was divine!

As written it makes a very thick "dip." I used the changes recommended by kj427, and reduced the buttermilk to 3/8 Cup...If you like it even thinner, use the 1/2 cup. I also did not use the seasoned salt. "I quite like this recipe with a few changes of my own and from those of other reviewers. First I decreased the sour cream to only 1/4 c. as I thought the sour cream flavor was a little overpowering. I added 1/2c. buttermilk to the mayo and used 1/8 tsp. seasoned salt in place of the regular salt, I also added 1/4 tsp. vinegar as had been suggested and upped the garlic powder to 1/2 tsp. With these changes I gave it 5 stars. Thanks for the recipe, it is wonderful!
I never realy liked Ranch dressing until this recipe. As is it is better as a dip. Throw in some lemon juce to liquifiy it...Salad dressing. I can't stop making it now.
Added 1 tsp vinegar, along with the adjustments noted in my earlier review.
This turned out better than the ranch dressing mix I was trying to replicate!

I hardly ever write reviews, but I read them obsessively. I also hate when people rate a recipe and include a multitude of changes made to the original recipe…. Having said that: I subbed Greek yogurt for the sour cream (simply because that’s what I had on hand) and cut the Mayo down to a little more than half a cup. I took over reviewers advice and made up the difference with half a cup of “faux” buttermilk (half cup milk and a tblsp of white vinegar). I tripled the parsley, garlic, and I onion powder because #spices and used fresh chives chopped very finely. Left out the dill this time as it didn’t fit the flavor profile I was using the ranch for (southwest egg rolls) 
Soooo good. Stupid good. Upsettingly good. Will for sure make again. And again. And again.

Love this recipe! I haven’t bought ranch dressing in years. I sub the Mayo/sour cream combo for 1/2 cup buttermilk, 1/2 cup mayonnaise and 1/2 cup plain Greek yogurt (or sour cream - whichever I have).

This is a keeper! We have a dairy allergy, so I’ll use it to make with unsweetened yogurt (instead of sour cream) for my husband. Tonight I made it as is, but it was a bit thick. I did as others recommended and made up some “buttermilk” to thin it out. I then added a small sprinkle of all the seasonings and a sprinkle of garlic salt. If it weren’t for this base recipe, it would not have turned out, so it’s definitely At least a 4 star recipe!
As others have said, you must thin this some or you end up with dip. I use whole milk.
I use buttermilk instead of sour cream to make a thinner dressing. Super tasty!
I've been making this recipe for years and it's our favorite. I'll sometimes switch out the sour cream for Greek yogurt. This is definitely a family favorite.
Big hit even with husband. Did not change a thing!!

I went with 1/4 c sour cream and 1/4 c buttermilk; extra garlic powder; extra chives and parsley; used garlic salt and celery salt; added a splash of vinegar after tasting. It hasn't had time to cure yet, but already tastes amazing. Can't wait for the final outcome. Thanks for setting me on the right path. This could be THE ranch.
This is a great ranch dip, it’s too thick to be a dressing. To make it a dressing I add equal parts sour cream and Mayo, double the spices and add 1/4 to 1/2 cup buttermilk.
Excellent Recipe!! I added a squeeze of lemon juice as well and whip it slightly in the stand mixer and it comes out excellent each time!!
What is the serving size? One tablespoon or two? It dose to say.
Very good ranch dressing recipe. Will make it again!
This is real good! Now I don’t have to buy bottled dressing. Thank you for sharing!
Nice flavor -- I made it as recommended and it is very good. I also made this 10% fat Greek yogurt and it is excellent that way.
Perfect just the way it is written, If you want it to pour easier I add a small amount of milk. Only recipe I use.
Luv it

Ranch Dressing II by Dawnia. Replaced half the mayo for buttermilk. Best yet. 
 Note4Me: Try this spice ratio sometime ... 1Tparsley,1t dill weed;1t onion powder;1t dried onion flakes;1t salt;1t garlic powder;1t garlic salt;1/4t ground pepper;1/2t sugar

This dressing is awesome! I used fresh herbs (about 2-3x the amount of dried) because we had so many to use. I also did a review suggestion and used 1/2 c buttermilk, 1/2 c mayo, and 1/2 c sour cream. Our little family loved it!
Perfect ranch dressing. I didn’t have chives or parsley and added a pinch more of the garlic, onion powder and dill and it was great! Add a little milk to thin it out.

Made this for dinner tonight! Yummy! I didn’t have any store bought ranch dressing so I made my own sans buttermilk. (Not something I keep on hand.) Regardless, it was very tasty and flavorful. Will make again. Will try store bought ranch dressing next time - or get some buttermilk - just to compare. The skin stuck to pan when frying. Will let chicken warm up to room temp use cast iron skillet next time.
I added 2 tsp champagne vinegar for a little tang. This is a thicker ranch perfect for dipping.
I added 2 tsp champagne vinegar for a little tang. This is a thicker ranch perfect for dipping.

It's a good recipe. As a previous reviewer said it doesn't taste right until it marinates together in the fridge for about half an hour. It makes all the difference. I have made it a couple of times and it is far better than store bought. I'm glad I tried it!
Lots of flavor and a good low-salt option. Thank you for such a great recipe!
I loved it!
Never going back to another ranch dressing.
Yummy! I took from another viewer's modifications by reducing sour cream to 1/4 C, adding 1/2 C buttermilk, adding 1/4 t more of garlic powder, 1/4t vinegar. PERFECT!!! THANK YOU, DAWNIA!!
Added fresh dill weed and fresh chives
Great recipe as written... I cannot have store bought ranch dressing so this was a great alternative! Thank you! :)

I will never buy Ranch dressing again!!! Love it!!! A tip...I didn't have sour cream, OR greek yogurt so I used regular Plain yogurt and it was just fine!! I will likely make it this way again as I always have the yogurt on hand. It's usually my go to, in place of sour cream and I am never disappointed.
I added 1/2 cup of 1/2 an 1/2, as it was too thick.

I have made this twice now. Once with sour cream and this time with buttermilk. My family likes the flavor of this much better than any I could buy in the store. And it doesn't take me that long to mix it up.
Great Ranch Recipe

This is my family’s favorite salad dressing. We make it exactly as is except we thin is down with some milk (maybe a few tablespoons). We normally multiply this recipe by 4 in order to make 2 quart jars of dressing.
My teenage son who is very picky about ranch even loves this!
Really tasty. Just what I was looking for
I used buttermilk..

This was an amazing find! It really taste much better than one from the store. I doubled spices, added buttermilk, grated fresh garlic and onion to taste. I loved it so much I just made another double batch! Also fantastic with gorgonzola:)
I liked it, my daughter said Hidden Valley better. Will try again!
I made this because I needed veggie dip. I used fresh dill - a lot of it. I added a bit or sriracha too. The texture is so creamy. It's a really good personalizable recipe.

If you like a great, fresh, Ranch dressing, this recipe is solid as is. 

COOK'S NOTE: If you have it handy, replace the sour cream with buttermilk 1:1; it makes it a little easier to pour. Also, I doubled the dill to 1 tsp. (or more) because I really love the herb. Enjoy!
I made this recipe as listed and it was perfect!

Very good and easy recipe! Followed everything the same but added a few splashes of buttermilk at the end to thin it out a bit. Also added a tad more salt to taste. I love ranch dressing but hate the store bought stuff, this tastes like when you’re out at a restaurant. Thanks for the recipe!
Too thick to eat easily on salad. Needs buttermilk to thin it out a bit
Couldn't be easier to make, and is delicious! I felt it really did taste fresher than the store-bought kind. It's well-seasoned and not too overpowering. A good staple item to have in your fridge!

Delicious!
Definitely make it hours before eating or better yet, the night before. I followed the recipe exactly, even though I read reviews but all I added was an extra 1/4 teaspoon of garlic powder (personal preference). 
Now I'm ready to wow my friends!
This is an excellent Ranch substitute for any family doing the Keto diet. My entire family loved it and the flavor gets better the longer it is refrigerated.

Good base recipe. Made it as is and was tasty but too thick and more like dip than dressing. So, I added a tablespoon dry buttermilk, juice from a lemon, and some filtered water. Tastes even better now and is the right consistency.
Not to bad

This has become my go-to dressing! Great on keto-friendly salads. I do thin it out with a couple of tablespoons of water, and I add a tablespoon of vinegar to tang up the flavor.

In my opinion, the easiest way to make this is to put all of the ingredients into smoothie or protein drink shaker with the little metal mixer ball in in it. Screw on the lid, make sure the pouring spout cap is snapped on tightly, shake well and you've got this delicious ranch dressing!
Super easy to make and it takes no time at all. I go just a bit more on the spices to exaggerate the flavor but either way it tastes great. It is very thick so keep that in mind.

I made it “as is” the first time, and it was fabulous. The second time, I substituted buttermilk for the sour cream, as per reviewers’ suggestions. Loved the flavour but found it a bit runny. Third time, I made it “as is” (but with fresh herbs) and *added* buttermilk until it was a consistency I liked. Bingo. People actually groan with delight and disbelief when they eat it. But no matter how you make it, substitutions or not, the recipe is a keeper.
Good light and fluffy

This has been my standard ranch dressing. The variations I use are a pinch of tarragon, about a Tbsp vinegar and about 2 Tbsp milk. Friends have said it's the best they ever had (with and without my variations).

Ran out of my daughters favorite... HVR dressing. I bought fresh snap peas, beans and broccoli from the farm stand, and dipping in a vinaigrette just wasn’t going to cut it. I had no chives, so I upped the onion powder by 1/4 teaspoon. She’s devouring it, as I type. Thank you... I may never buy that bottled stuff again!
Added homemade buttermilk so it was less like a dip. Very good and so economical!
I added a 1/4 cup of half-and-half to thin it out just a bit. Was perfect!
Exchanged sour cream for 2/3 C. buttermilk. (It was a little to thick). I also added a little more of the herbs.
So Good!
I made this as written and it was really good. It's now my go to, no more store bought.
Quick. Good.
I make this once a week. I haven't bought ranch dressing since I tried this recipe. I add a little more spices than called for. It's delicious and so easy to make.

I subbed 1 PKG of cream cheese and a 1/4 cup of heavy cream to make this a keto friendly vegi dip/spread. Turned out fantastic. 
I would use either more cream or buttermilk or both to thin it down as a dressing.
My favorite recipe of all ranch dressings I have.
This is by far the best Ranch Dressing recipe. I love garlic and dill, so I double the amount of both of those. Sooooo addictively delicious!
I will never eat store bought ranch dressing again. This was easy to make and delicious ......
This was a great recipe. I minced some sliced jalapenos that you buy in the jar. Turned it into jalapeno ranch. Better than bottled dressing or dip. I will definitely be making this again.
Awesome recipe!!! I found it to be a little thick, more like a dip, so I added more milk until it got to the consistency I was looking for. :)
Why did I ever buy Ranch dressing? Ten times better and costs less than the "healthy" Ranch dressings with all their ingredients.
Why did I ever buy Ranch dressing? Ten times better and costs less than the "healthy" Ranch dressings with all their ingredients.
It’s awesome and easy to make. You have to thin it to actually pour it. I used unsweetened rice milk.

Great recipe! I dislike the bottled dressings as they are too salty and expire before we can use them up. I make up a bottle or container of the dry ingredients to have on hand and make smaller batches as needed.

I am in ranch heaven!! We quit buying ranch years ago because of all the added chemicals. I have tried numerous 'organic' flavors that I never bought again because I just couldn't get beyond the taste. But since I have been discovering just how many things I can make at home (think dry onion soup, again from this site!) i thought I would try this. And score!! We do double the garlic (just because Im a garlic lover) and use 3/4 cups of mayo (we never seem to let it set long enough before dinner to let the flavors meld) but I'm sure it's awesome even as originally wrote! Thank you, Dawnia!!!!!
I've made this twice, both times it was awesome. The second time I added 2 table spoons of apple cider vinegar, it added a little tang.

10/10 will make again. Very thick consistency (figured I could add buttermilk if it was too thick, but this is perfect for dipping veggies in). Literally the spoon stands upright, hah!

Modifications: Didn't have sour cream, substituted same amount of plain Greek yogurt. Didn't have any parsley at all (whoops).

We have modified this to our preferences, but love the recipe even as written. We let the girls use a mortar and pestle to grind fine the parsley and chives, and then combine all dry ingredients in a lidded container so we can just measure out what is needed when it’s time for a new batch of dressing! (So we generally quadruple the recipe lol)
Quite thick and if necessary could easily add milk. Made in my immersion blender with fresh dill and plain yogurt instead of sour cream.
So delicious and fresh! I use fresh Dill and Chives! I added 1/2 cup of buttermilk and the consistency was perfect! My family doesn’t ever want any other Ranch Dressing! Thank you!
I use fat free plain Greek yogurt instead of sour cream. Also used low cal mayo just to make it a bit less fattening. Super delicious

Had already whipped up Mayo/Sour Cream and a little touch of milk ( just a consistency preference) went to the spice cabinet and found I was OUT of my ranch dip mixes! What!?! Found your recipe and mixed it exactly as written. Moral of this story: I will never buy a mix again....who knew I could make my own that tastes as good if not even better and without all of the unwanted/added ! Yay! Thank you Dawnia you literally saved my bacon with this recipe.

This is a great base recipe for ranch vegetable dip. As is, it's great, I mainly use it for dipping vegetables and stuff in it. If you want a dressing like consistency for salad greens, use less mayo (or skip it) and just use sour cream and buttermilk. My husband and I like to add some Tabasco sauce or some cayenne pepper to it occasionally to give it a it of bite, to change it up. Some days I'll add some fresh Lime juice and use an avocado in place of some of the mayo and the buttermilk to make Tex-Mex ranch.
Awesome ranch dressing and not store bought with so many preservatives. Since I live in Japan this is a GREAT way to get a dressing I miss from back home.
I have made this several times..But I used Duke's Mayonnaise...This is my go to Keto Ranch Dressing..Gets better as it sits
I really love this easy ranch recipe. I used a splash of fresh lemon juice and fresh parsley and it was so good! It is thick, so will add a little milk for salads but much tastier than store bought!
I used equal amounts of mayo, sour cream and plain yogurt, then added the spices accordingly.

Exactly what I’ve been searching for to have at home. Almost identical to one of my favorite restaurants! I did follow advice of another and used 1/2 cups of mayo/sour cream/buttermilk and added tsp vegetable oil for thinner consistency.
Yum!!! Didn’t have chives, subbed season salt for regular salt

This, can be easily veganized, by using vegan mayo, (Just Mayo, Veganaise, etc.), vegan sour cream (Follow Your Heart), vegan "buttermilk" [plant based beverage {soy, oat, almond, rice, etc.} with lemon juice added].

I never add vinegar to anything, I just hate the taste of it. I add lemon juice instead, which adds tang and brightens the dressing up. 

I use Just Mayo vegan mayo, which I think is way too vinegary, so, I tried different things, to try and counter act it. I tried adding a few tbs of apple juice , and it worked!

One might also use pickle juice, instead of apple juice, to counter act an overly vinegary taste, and use up pickle juice that most people just throw out, when the pickles are gone.

I tried green olive brine, as a diluter & salt additive, and it tones down the vinegar taste as well, adds depth of flavor, and uses up olive brine, that most people just throw away, when the olives are gone.

 So, there are many different ways one could tweak this recipe to their exact liking. 

 I cook cubed potatoes for potato salad, in the diluted olive brine, and they come out tasty. 

I cook pasta for pasta salad in diluted pickle juice, and it adds more flavor. 

 I just didn't like wasting a whole jar of pickle juice, and olive brine, so I tried to invent ways to use them up. 

One can also use pickle juice as the liquid in meatloaf/veggie loaf. 

One can make a savory bread, by using it in place of water, when making bread dough, add some herbs to

I used sour cream and buttermilk, added a bit more of all the spices, and used fresh chives. I loved it! A couple of my tasters said it was missing tang so I added a bit of apple cider vinegar and they became super fans of this recipe!

I made it as listed but added a tablespoon of milk to thin it down. Others stated to used buttermilk instead of sour cream but I liked the flavor of sour cream. It was very tasty. I think the longer it sits the better it will be? I only let it sit for 15 minutes. Will definitely make it again. I love knowing what is in my dressing.
This is so good.
How long will this stay good in the refrigerator?
